revised_title: Sorption and Molecular Sieve Properties of Clays and Their Importance as Catalysts
tldr: This article discusses the sorption and molecular sieve properties of clay minerals, focusing on their importance as catalysts. It compares the inclusion of guest species in zeolites, clay minerals, and clathrates, and explores the different types of sorbents and their isotherms. The article also highlights the role of clay minerals in catalyzing various reactions, such as cracking, isomerization, and redox reactions.
